metadata.title: CVE-2023-3812 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds memory access flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s TUN/TAPdevice driver functionality in how a user generates a malicious (too big)networking packet when napi frags is enabled. This flaw allows a local userto crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3812` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1108-fips - 4.15.0-1108.119
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1108-fips - 4.15.0-1108.119
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1108-fips - 4.15.0-1108.119
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1108-fips - 4.15.0-1108.119
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2090-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2090.96
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2090-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2090.96
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2071-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2071.77
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2071-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2071.77
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2055-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2055.60
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2055-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2055.60
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
